channel.title: Real Timers
channel.description:
Hi, I've been into editing RS private servers for a while (although I can't code from scratch really, yet), and I recently decided to take a look at how the (hella glitchy) combat system works. I'm using Cheez PK 78. I've now realised just why massing in fights speeds up attacks - all because of the crappy timers in [i]public boolean process[/i]. Now, because I'd want a decent combat system to be part of my server, I want to add [i]real[/i] timers to my server. I've recently spent a couple of days trying to research timers in Java using Google but, because I don't know much about Java, i'm finding it difficult. :\ I try not to usually ask for help, and do the research myself but, this time, I'm sick to death of trying to find out about timers.
Here's basically what I'm looking for: a timer (or something) which adds or subtracts from a public int in milliseconds. I hope i'm not talking a load of crap here - I'm new to this. If anyone could tell me how, or even guide me towards getting real timers set up in my server, It'd [b]really[/b] appreciate it. :cool:
Thanks in advance.
[i]If there's anything wrong with this post, I apologise. Please tell me what I've done wrong and I'll fix it. This is my first post. Thanks ;-)[/i]

item.title: Real Timers
item.dc:creator: @Evo Evo
item.description:
@Evo wrote:

ahh, thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Real Timers
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I think System.currentTimeMillis and some basic math really is all you need :\

Read full topic
